etymologies: mid 16th century: modern Latin, from Greek sundromē, from sun- ‘together’ + dramein ‘to run’

definitions: a group of symptoms which consistently occur together, or a condition characterized by a set of associated symptoms

examples.text: a rare syndrome in which the production of white blood cells is damaged

shortDefinitions: group of symptoms which consistently occur together, or condition characterized by set of associated symptoms

definitions: a characteristic combination of opinions, emotions, or behavior
shortDefinitions: characteristic combination of opinions or behaviour
